turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm trying to understand why a claim for my recent doctor's visit was denied. Can you help?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly. I can access claim information. To get started, please provide your name, date of birth, and the date of service for the denied claim.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, my name is Alice Smith, born 05/10/1980, and the date of service was 08/15/2024. I'm so frustrated, I need to understand why this was denied!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you, Alice. I am looking into the claim now. It appears the denial reason is 'missing pre-authorization.' Can you confirm if your insurance required a pre-authorization for that specific procedure?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Pre-authorization? I didn't know! The doctor just ordered a routine blood test. How am I supposed to know all this stuff? And, if pre-authorization was required, how do I get the claim reconsidered?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. To have the claim reconsidered, you'll need to obtain the pre-authorization information from your doctor's office and submit it to the insurance company. You can typically do this by calling the number on the back of your insurance card or submitting the information online. I can provide the contact information for your insurance provider if you'd like.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yes, please. That would be very helpful. And, is there a time limit for submitting the pre-authorization?
